item.title: NRS3server 667 (No anti-leech)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:62, topic:446277”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=549140.msg4025754#msg4025754 date=1340317156]
Si Force, that’s not what the change should have been. It needs to be that if you release something other people can use it, not re-release it. People can only re-release a base with the owners permission, or if they made enough edits for it to be considered different (in which case they credit it as their ‘base’ or ‘source’, and give it a new name).

However, antileeches are also not allowed in bases, look at the main forum ideals (“we are not antileech” etc), so if you can link to the original thread (if it’s on moparscape) we can take care of that too.
[/quote]

We’re no longer getting involved with these issues. If a member releases his server, he should expect it to be re-released. If what you’re saying was to be true, feel free to remove the majority of the server downloads in this section, as most would break that.[/quote][quote=“Davidi2, post:58, topic:446277”]People can only re-release a base with the owners permission, or if they made enough edits for it to be considered different (in which case they credit it as their ‘base’ or ‘source’, and give it a new name).[/quote]^ that’s what most servers are now, people editing a source and then releasing it as their own source

Read full topic

item.title: NRS3server 667 (No anti-leech)
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:58, topic:446277”]Si Force, that’s not what the change should have been. It needs to be that if you release something other people can use it, not re-release it. People can only re-release a base with the owners permission, or if they made enough edits for it to be considered different (in which case they credit it as their ‘base’ or ‘source’, and give it a new name).

However, antileeches are also not allowed in bases, look at the main forum ideals (“we are not antileech” etc), so if you can link to the original thread (if it’s on moparscape) we can take care of that too.[/quote]

We’re no longer getting involved with these issues. If a member releases his server, he should expect it to be re-released. If what you’re saying was to be true, feel free to remove the majority of the server downloads in this section, as most would break that.

Read full topic

item.title: NRS3server 667 (No anti-leech)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Si Force, that’s not what the change should have been. It needs to be that if you release something other people can use it, not re-release it. People can only re-release a base with the owners permission, or if they made enough edits for it to be considered different (in which case they credit it as their ‘base’ or ‘source’, and give it a new name).

However, antileeches are also not allowed in bases, look at the main forum ideals (“we are not antileech” etc), so if you can link to the original thread (if it’s on moparscape) we can take care of that too.

item.title: NRS3server 667 (No anti-leech)
item.dc:creator: @Kr3m1in Kr3m1in
item.description:
@Kr3m1in wrote:

[quote="…::Coded::…, post:54, topic:446277"][quote author=nick704 link=topic=549140.msg4025740#msg4025740 date=1340316616]
I realeased this with the upmost respect of those who acualy made it, and i think it deserved to be released with out the anti-leech and also i updated the people in the credits list.
[/quote]

If you respected those who made it you wouldn’t have done this, it was the Releasers decision to put an anti leech, removing is a slap in the face.

Not pressuring you to remove so the troll stays out of my ass[/quote]

Where is this troll you speak of? If you’re implying that it is me, I’m just preaching the rules that have been set forth by the admins of this wonderful forum. I hope you realize someday that rules trump personal opinions and beliefs.

si should still be a rule that you cant release without owners permission so basically this is more leeching[/quote]
